meanings.definition: To move from one place to another
meanings.sent1: The birds were transmigrating south for the winter.
meanings.sent2: She was transmigrating to a new city for a job opportunity.
meanings.sent3: The ants were transmigrating to the picnic area, looking for food.
meanings.sent4: The clouds transmigrating across the sky, changing shapes as they moved.
meanings.sent5: The river transmigrating through the valley, carving its path over time.

meanings.definition: To pass from one state or form to another
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar was transmigrating into a butterfly inside the cocoon.
meanings.sent2: Her emotions were transmigrating from sadness to joy as she received good news.
meanings.sent3: The clay was transmigrating into a beautiful vase under the skilled hands of the potter.
meanings.sent4: The old building was transmigrating into a modern office space after renovations.
meanings.sent5: The tadpole was transmigrating into a frog, growing legs and losing its tail.

meanings.definition: To wander or travel from place to place
meanings.sent1: The nomads were transmigrating across the desert in search of water.
meanings.sent2: The lost dog was transmigrating through the neighborhood, looking for its owner.
meanings.sent3: The tourists were transmigrating through the historic city, exploring its landmarks.
meanings.sent4: The clouds were transmigrating lazily in the sky, carried by the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The thoughts were transmigrating in his mind, jumping from one idea to another.
